page.title: 15TOURISM
page.content: Many people from all over the world come to see the Andrew Carnegie Birthplace Museum in Moodie Street. It commemorates Andrew Carnegie's rise from weaver's son to 'King of Steel'. The cottage also has a shop where one can buy a souvenir of the visit. The city chambers is an eye-catching building with many turrets and spires. The clock face is lit up at night. Visitors are sometimes taken on a guided tour of the city chambers. The Public Park is a favourite place for children to visit. It has swings, slides, climbing frames, roundabouts etc. There are also tennis courts, trampolines and table tennis facilities available for the public.
